name: 郭志宇
objective: Engineering Mathematics (II) will be divided into four parts: (1)Series Solution of ODEs, (2) Fourier analysis, (3) Partial Differential Equations, and (4) vector differential and integral calculus.
schedule:
1st    Series Solution of ODEs, Power Series Method
2nd   Legendre’s Equation, Frobenius Method
3rd   Bessel’s Function
4th    Fourier Series, Half-Range Expansions 
5th    Fourier Integral
6th   Orthogonal Functions
7th    Orthogonal Eigenfunction Expansions
8th   First Midterm Exam
9th    Partial Differential Equations: Basic Concepts, Wave Function
10th   Heat Equation: Solution by Separating Variables
11th  Heat Equation: Solution by Separating Variables
12th  Laplace’s Equation in Cylindrical and Spherical Coordinates. Potential
13th  Second Midterm Exam
14th Vector Differential Calculus
15th  Vector Differential Calculus
16th  Vector Integral Calculus 
17th   Vector Integral Calculus 
18th  Final Exam
scorePolicy:
1. Present/absent 10%
2. Quiz 10% each  30% total
3. Mid-term, final term 20% each 60% total
materials: Kreyszig, E., Advanced Engineering Mathematics, 10th Ed., John Wiley & Sons, Singapore (2018).
